data.title: Touch Input Scaling and iOS Exceptions
data.body:
This is the first work at getting touch events to be scaled to the back buffer and/or user supplied display size ala XNA.  See this thread...

http://monogame.codeplex.com/discussions/390041

I plan to make a pass unifying all the Mouse.cs implementations so that I can clean up this code a bit more.

Also this pull removed the catch all exception handler around Game.Tick() on iOS.  It was swallowing exceptions and closing the app instead of letting the normal unhandled exception process from occurring.

data.title: Android - graphics corruption when Activity is recreated
data.body: In developer settings in Ice Cream Swch there is "Don't keep activities", AKA "Immediately destroy activities". When I tried this with MonoGame develop3d branch, I started to get very funky graphics glitches upon resuming the game. Note that it uses Models and Effects. Not sure if the SpriteBatch overlays were also affected.

data.title: Weird text rendering on Linux [develop3d branch]
IntermediateSerializer does not create compatible xml structures.

milestone.title: Content Pipleline Release
milestone.description: This milestone will be used to track Content Pipeline related issues. It has no release date as yet.

data.body:
A common way of generating basic xml files in xna is to use the IntermediateSerializer, which currently does not treat the MonoGame Vector2 type the same as XNA's Vector2 type, this probably extends to other data basic types such as Rectangle, Vector3 etc.

A Vector2 example of the generated and expect input within the content pipe line would be:
Monogame

``` xml
        <position>
          <X>200</X>
          <Y>200</Y>
        </position>
```

Non Monogame:

``` xml
        <position>200 200</position>
```

Notice the additional X and Y elements.
This is likely unexpected behavior and would probably create confusion when migrating.
Seen within the Develop branch.

data.title: Develop3d
data.body: The preprocessor #include handling in 2MGFX is now behaving more like fxc's own preprocessor regarding sub directories includes

data.title: Build failure in latest revision due to OpenTKGamePlatform
data.body:
The method OnIsMouseVisibleChanged() of class OpenTKGamePlatform is causing the build to fail for the latest develop3d revision on Windows 7 for two reasons:

'OpenTK.GameWindow' does not contain a definition for 'CursorVisible' and no extension method 'CursorVisible' accepting a first argument of type 'OpenTK.GameWindow' could be found

'OpenTK.Input.Mouse' does not contain a definition for 'SetPosition'

data.title: SpriteBatch.DrawString not working properly on iOS
data.body:
When running the Draw2D and SpriteFont samples, instead of drawing text, DrawString draws small black boxes. I replaced the SpriteFont xnb, and the problem persisted. I tested this on device and in the iOS simulator, but not on any other platforms.

Note: I've verified that DrawString works properly in the 2.5 MonoGame release.

data.title: Gamepad analogue sticks & Accelerator don't work
data.body:
Impementation is there but i can't get any Values other than zero.

Device: Playstation Vita

data.title: Fixes to GL.DepthRange and GLClearDepth for OpenGL 2.0 plus Lidgren changes
data.body:
Added changes to the calls to GL.DepthRange and GL.ClearDepth as the Openg 2.0 versions do not support float parameters. Needs checking on iOS, Mac and Linux

Abstracted out the Dependency on System.Net.Sockets.Socket into a new PlatformSocket which can be tweaked to support the underlying patform. Currently Windows/Andoroid/iOs/Max and linux all use the same class. This is so we can implement a specific PlatformSocket class for Windows 8 or Windows Phone.

data.title: ContentManager doesn't easily support custom non-content file loading.
data.body: I found myself unable to properly add support for loading my own content files from non-content classes as MonoGame does when XNB files are unavailable, so I added virtual methods to ContentManager that makes this possible.

data.title: Screen resizing no longer working after Game.Initialize() call with ApplyChanges().
Memory leak when drawing to RenderTexture2D
SpriteBatch Transformation Matrix not being applied - Windows build.
data.body:
My Code

```
spriteBatch.Begin(ssm, BlendState.AlphaBlend, SamplerState.PointClamp,
                       DepthStencilState.None, RasterizerState.CullCounterClockwise, null, matrixView);
```

Line 181 SpriteBatch.cs - Only place its used.

```
GL.LoadMatrix(ref _matrix.M11);
```

I'm unsure if the matrix property is correct or if its being used at all in the render process for OpenGL. I have tried this across a few revisions and they all seem to have the same result.

I can however use the GL.Scale method to get the effect I wanted, by passing a Vector2 as a scale parameter in the Draw method, but its a work around and doesn't allow me to use other types of Matrix transforms in the render.

data.title: Mac OpenAL SoundEffects Pitch
data.body:
Pitch conversion from XNA to OpenAL isn't made on MacOSX making the SoundEffects not playing. 

It has been fixed on Linux before with this issue (https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/pull/557). It uses the XnaPitchToAlPitch method.

data.title: OpenTKGamePlatform doesn't compile
Fixed Windows 8 build.
data.body: A few Windows 8 fixes for https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/pull/631.

data.title: Windows8 ApplyChanges bug
ApplyChanges does not throws exception if called inside the Game's const...
data.body: ...ructor.

data.title: Wrong kerning in SpriteFont (tested on develop3D, Win8)
data.body:
There is a small problem with SpriteFont kerning, some couples of characters are not displayed correctly. Screenshot (compared to XNA 4.0): http://twitpic.com/ag3qqh

Tested on develop3D branch, Windows 8 metro (font Lithos Pro Regular).
You can download this .spritefont and .xnb file here: http://tomasslavicek.aspone.cz/font_lithos.zip (the font is also attached for your testing, but it is a licenced, non-free font).

data.title: Develop3d: Big random bag of changes...
data.body:
Need to make sure I didn't break iOS/Android/Windows too much...

Anyway:

```
Random things fixed:
   -Loading WAVs from WaveBanks
   -Resizing on Linux/Windows in some cases
   -Reenable TextureCube.GetData on Mac
   -VertexBuffer.GetData for struct types, though now it's slower probably
   -Calling ApplyChanges in the ctor should work
   -Mouse visibility on Mac
   -Projects with no content files on Mac
   -IndexBufferReader indexes shouldn't be write only


Random new things implemented:
   -Fleshed out support for XACT stuff a bit
      -parses Xact General Settings files properly thanks to documentation by ShinAli, but doesn't handle them properly yet

   -EffectMaterial/EffectMaterialReader
   -ExternalReferenceReader

   -Mouse.SetPosition on Mac

   -OcclusionQuery on Mac only
   -Stub Texture3D on Mac only

   -Binormal/Tangent attributes (untested)
   -SurfaceFormat.Single (still doesn't conform exactly to XNA, see the ShadowMapping sample :/)
   -ConstantBuffer sub-elements

   -Indexing methods in ModelMeshCollection

   -Stub GraphicsDevice.GraphicsDeviceStatus
   -Stub FrameworkDispatcher
   -Game.RunOneFrame (untested)
   -Game.OnActivated/OnDeactivated methods


Random things moved and changed:
   -Updated MojoShader build
   -Update Samples commit

   -Merged Media.MediaLibrary, Media.MediaSource

   -(Initially an attempt to) reintroduce runtime support for XNA Effects on Mac and Linux
      (in a way that's hopefully sufficiently modular - it 'connects' in only a single line)

      -Renamed and reorganised a bunch of stuff:
         -2MGFX.DXEffectObject -> 2MGFX.DXEffectObject.(fxparser, writer)
         -2MGFX.DXShader -> 2MGFX.DXShaderData.(mojo, sharpdx, writer)
         -2MGFX.ConstantBuffer -> 2MGFX.DXConstantBufferData
         -Effect.DXShader -> Effect.Shader.(dx11,ogl), Effect.MGFXShader
```

data.title: [FX Compilation] Postprocess pixel only shaders issue
data.body: MonoGameContentProcessor Effect compiler currently requires that your fx file assigns both a vertex and pixel shader. This prevents postprocess shaders from compiling that would normally only implement a pixel shader. Tried using VertexShader = NULL; in the technique pass but still get error stating that the parser is expecting a "compile" instruction. Normally passing in null would revert to the default vertex shader. I Suggest allowing passing in null For vertex shaders and even pixel shaders in case a pixel-only or vertex-only shader is desired.

data.title: OpenAL32.dll on Ubuntu Linux
data.body:
I'm using the develop3d branch, but when I run an application I get the following:

OpenGL Warning: XGetVisualInfo returned 0 visuals for 0x9779828
OpenGL Warning: Retry with 0x8002 returned 0 visuals

Unhandled Exception: System.DllNotFoundException: openal32.dll
  at (wrapper managed-to-native) OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.Alc:OpenDevice (string)
  at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Audio.OpenALSoundController..ctor () [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 

I don't know what to install (on Ubuntu 12) to get it working.
I've found libopenal.so on my system and tried adding a dllmap from openal32.dll to it but that doesn't help

What do I need to install to get things set up on Ubuntu?

data.title: Metro Touch Events Issues
data.body:
When checking to see if user tap on the screen the results are not consistent. Majority of the times tapping  the screen returns a moved event instead of a pressed event.

I am trying  port my Xna game over to A metro 8 app game.  The same code runs fine on windows phone 7.

Any ideas?

data.title: Develop3d Building Texture on second thread might cause crash
data.body:
I am constructing a Texture2d on a secondary thread while the main one is sleepy
the texture2d constructor calls  Threading.BlockOnUIThread
that in short stops current thread and performs the argument's action in the main thread
this causes a hangup of the whole application since the main thread cannot perform the request
This is not appening on original xna implementation from MS

data.title: Update of Libs OpenTK to the latest head from svn.
XnaTouch Cleanup
data.body: Removed old duplicate XnaTouch implementations of CompareFunction and StencilOperation.

data.title: Fixed MacOS Build
data.body:
Fixing something I broke with my last commit.

https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/issues/650

data.title: MacGamePlatform compilation error
data.body:
There seems to be a problem with compiling InitializeMainWindow in MacGamePlatform.cs.

changing the first line of this method from:
RectangleF frame = new RectangleF(
                0, 0,
                PresentationParameters._defaultBackBufferWidth,
                PresentationParameters._defaultBackBufferHeight);

to:
RectangleF frame = new RectangleF(
                0, 0,
                GraphicsDeviceManager.DefaultBackBufferWidth,
                GraphicsDeviceManager.DefaultBackBufferHeight);

Appears to fix the problem
